newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Dutch PTT wins Dutch paging network licence.
newsitem.headline: Dutch PTT wins Dutch paging network licence.

text.p: The Dutch transport ministry said on Friday it had granted two licences for building and operating a nation-wide paging network in the Netherlands to Dutch firms PTT Telecom and CallMax.
The PTT unit already had a provisional licence and will now have to compete with unlisted CallMax in operating a paging network which is set up according to the European ERMES standard.
The transport ministry had offered three ten-year licences through a tender procedure but said no suitable candidate had been found for the third.
Awarding the licences is a further step towards a full liberalisation of the Dutch telecommunications by 1998, the ministry said in a statement.
